intro: Aglaia rufibarbis, commonly known as the red-whiskered beauty, is a tropical flowering plant belonging to the family Meliaceae. It is characterized by its glossy, ovate leaves and striking, fragrant yellow flowers with prominent red stamens. The plant produces woody capsules containing elliptical, dark brown seeds. Native to Southeast Asia, it thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
